results.title: Legends of the fall [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Edward Zwick, Marshall Herskovitz, Patrick Crowley and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel of the same name by Jim Harrison, this sweeping period saga of three brothers, their powerful father and a beautiful women loved by them all, is set against lush Montana scenery. The film covers decades in the lives of Alfred (Aidan Quinn), Tristan (Brad Pitt) and Samuel (Henry Thomas) Ludlow, the sons of retired military man William Ludlow (Anthony Hopkins). Raised by the unorthodox Ludlow after the departure of their mother, the boys grew up close, sharing an appreciation of the land and a pioneering spirit. The family becomes divided however, when young Sam enlists in World War I over his father’s objections, and his brothers follow suit to protect him. Sam dies in battle, leaving Alfred and Tristan to return home and deal with the lingering torment. Further complicating matters is the presence of Sam’s beautiful fiancee, Susannah (Julia Ormond). After Sam’s death she attracts the attentions of both the responsible Alfred and the brooding Tristan, a conflict that threatens to drive the brothers apart forever.

results.title: Limbo
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi and Green/Renzi
results.brief_description: Writer/director Sayles once again takes his audience to a place they may never have been before - both psychologically and geographically. Traumatized by a boating accident that killed two friends, Joe Gastineau (David Strathairn) has given up hope for a life beyond the odd jobs he takes to support himself. Everything changes when struggling singer Donna De Angelo (Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio) and her troubled teenage daughter enter his life. Both mother and daughter fall for Joe, increasing the already-present friction between them. The tension continues to build until Joe’s fast-talking half-brother Bobby returns to town, sparking a chain of events that will change all of their lives forever. This is an engrossing movie with engaging characters, overlaid on the extraordinary setting of the rugged Alaskan wilderness.

results.title: Silverado [DVD]
results.brief_description: Silverado is an old west frontier town in the evil grip of a corrupt and powerful, smiling-viper sheriff (Brian Dennehy). But things are about to change around town. Four unlikely heroes - brothers Emmett (Scott Glenn) and Jake (Kevin Costner), adventurer Paden (Kevin Kline), and a crack-shot negro cowboy (Danny Glover)- saddle up for a series of dangerous adventures on the dusty trail to Silverado. From its explosive, breathtaking opening gun battle to a final, tense high-noon shoot-out, this thrilling, hell-for-leather western is bursting with spectacular action. This is director Kasdan’s tribute to the great and much-loved tradition of the Wild West.

results.title: Vertigo [DVD]
results.brief_description: Arguably one of Hitchcock’s greatest films, “Vertigo” is a tense and riveting film about obsession, desire and betrayal. James Stewart plays a cop with a fear of heights who is hired to keep an eye on the wife (Kim Novak) of an old friend. He falls in love with her, and her tragic death haunts him until he meets another woman who reminds him of her. His obsession with remodelling his new love into the image of the dead woman leads him further and further into a sinister nightmare world in which nothing and no-one is who they seem. With Barbara Bel Geddes and ravishing production credits. Based on “D’Entre les Mortes” by Pierre Boileau and Thomas Narcejac.

results.title: Midnight express [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam and Casablanca Films
results.brief_description: A young tourist, Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), travelling in Turkey is arrested for possession of hashish. The film traces his experiences, often violent and terrifying, in a foreign jail and his attempts to escape and cross the border into freedom. The cast also features John Hurt and Randy Quaid with a script by Oliver Stone. The film is based on Billy Hughes’ book of the same title relating his jail experiences.

results.title: The Big chill [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Michael Shamberg and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: The archetypal “Baby Boomers” movie of the 80’s which focuses on a group of college friends from the 60’s who have exchanged their radical ideals for Mercedes’ and “Yuppiedom”. In coming together at the funeral of one of their group, they strive to regain touch, not only with one another but with themselves. What follows is a weekend of drugs, sex, a re-examination of their anti-establishment days and a reconciliation of their past with their present. “In a cool world you need your friends to keep you warm.” This film will remain a nostalgic favourite. It features a great soundtrack and an early screen appearance by Kevin Costner as the corpse. Cast includes Tom Berenger, Glenn Close, Jeff Goldblum, William Hurt, Kevin Kline, Mary Kay Place, Meg Tilly and Jobeth Williams.

results.title: Gattaca [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Niccol, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito and Jersey Films
results.brief_description: Niccol’s debut as a director, a year before he wrote the script for ‘The Truman Show’, is set in a near-future where the lives of the majority of citizens are determined before birth through genetic engineering of their genes, and the ‘natural-born’ minority of ‘In-Valids’ is shunned. Vincent Freeman (Ethan Hawke) is one of the latter, who, in order to pursue his goal of travelling into space, assumes the identity of a member of the genetic elite (Jude Law). His cover is threatened when he becomes a suspect in a murder investigation. With a relentless investigator in pursuit and the colleague he has fallen in love with beginning to suspect his deception, his dreams begin to unravel. Cast includes Uma Thurman, Ethan Hawke, Alan Arkin, Jude Law and Ernest Borgnine.

results.title: Run Lola run = Lola Rennt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tom Tykwer, Stefan Arndt, X filme creative Pool, WDR, NRW, German Independents, FilmFernsehFonds Bayern, FFA - Filmforderungsanstalt, Bavaria Film, BMI and Arte
results.brief_description: Time is running out for Lola (Franka Potente). She’s just received a frantic phone call from her boyfriend Manni (Moritz Bleibtreu), who’s lost a small fortune in cash belonging to his Mob boss. Now she has to run for his life, to try and come up with the money before Manni pays the ultimate price for his mistake. Using a destiny device, the story begins anew with different outcomes. Other cinematic techniques which add to the breakneck pace and excitement of this innovative thriller include jump cuts, whip pans, slow and fast motion, split-screen, intercut colour and black and white, segment titles and animation.

results.title: Godzilla
results.creator_credit: Roland Emmerich, Dean Devlin and Centropolis Pictures
results.brief_description: Perhaps one of the world’s most famous and enduring characters, Godzilla first appeared on Japanese screens in the 1954 release “Gojira”. In this version, the monster lizard has been created on a remote island somewhere in the South Pacific by nuclear testing, and she is heading to America, land of plenty, to hatch her offspring. Fantastic special effects make this the ultimate monster movie - a 20 story tall lizard with one thing on her mind.

results.title: The Time of your life
results.creator_credit: H C Potter, William Cagney and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film is more than just a comedy - it was a labour of love for James Cagney and his brother, producer, William Cagney. Set in a waterfront saloon in San Francisco, the film has a warm and engaging atmosphere about it. It is entirely ‘laid back” - indeed Cagney remains seated for most of the picture. Joe (Cagney) is a philosophical souse who encourages all those around him to indulge in their wildest dreams. Joe’s pal Tom (Wayne Morris), a born patsy, runs errands for Joe, the only person who has ever shown him kindness. Kitty (Jeanne Cagney), a streetwalker, willingly allows Joe to sponge drinks off her in exchange for a few kind words. Harry (Paul Draper), an enthusiastic but hopelessly untalented dancer-comedian, is hired by bartender Nick (William Bendix) at Joe’s urging. And Kit Carson (James Barton), an addled old man who lives in a dream world, is prodded by Joe into weaving his unlikely reminisces of the Wild West. Based on the whimsical play by William Saroyan.
